text.p: These are the leading stories in the Angolan press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Some 10,000 Unita troops are stranded in the former Zaire and are trying to return to Angola, according to the Portuguese daily Diario de Noticias.

- Portuguese Attorney-General Jose de Cunha met Angolan President Jose Eduardo dos Santos and Prime Minister Franca Van-Dunem on Tuesday, where questions of bilateral cooperation dominated discussions.
- Van-Dumen also met a business delegation from Gabon.
